Maya Benari

About Work Contact

I’m a designer and frontend developer. I design and build websites for meaningful projects around the globe. I'm into people, tech, art, and design.

Recent Work

  • Demand Clean Power

    I led frontend development for a national campaign for the National Resource Defense Council that received hundreds of thousands of visits at launch. By using subtle animations, we were able to bring storytelling elements to life and engage users to sign the petition rejecting the Keystone XL pipeline.

     frontend development interaction design

  • Homebase

    As a Code for America fellow, I developed Homebase, a web application to renovate housing safely and efficiently for residents in San Antonio. With an easy step-by-step online process, we reshaped how the city provides services and empowered residents to own the city they live in.

     design development branding strategy

  • Mobile Orchestra

    I created Mobile Orchestra to represent with sound moving bike groups, like Critical Mass. Loops from Jono Brandel’s Patatap stream into the group as bikers enter the group.

     design development

  • Swipes for the Homeless

    I developed the website for Swipes for the Homeless, a White House recognized organization that collects unused meal swipes from university students and delivers food to local shelters.

     development responsive design

  • SF Living Innovation Zones

    I designed and developed a tool for the Living Innovation Zones project with the San Francisco Mayor’s Office of Innovation. The website lets people discover and vote on ideas for new projects, creating vibrant spaces in the streets they live in.

     design concept development

  • Traveling Spoon

    I designed and developed the website for Traveling Spoon, a platform to discover authentic, vetted home food experiences in India, Thailand, and Vietnam.

     design development

  • Logo for Human Rights

    There is no universal symbol for human rights. My submission in the global competition advanced to the top 100 finalists out of 15,000 submissions.

     design branding logo

  • World Affairs Council of Brazil

    I led the Brazilian and US teams to design and develop a new web presence for the World Affairs Council of Brazil, engaging and educating Brazilians of all ages about Brazilian issues of the times.

     project lead development

  • Lasting Actions

    I designed and developed the website for Lasting Actions, an organization dedicated to providing children around the world access to education and technology.

     design development

  • Project Nicaragua

    I created the designs and developed the website for Project Nicaragua, an organization that spans university medical students and doctors to bring healthcare to underserved hospitals in Nicaragua.

     design development

  • My Head Hurts

    I worked with verynice and former MVP of UCLA football, Bryan Larimore, to develop a storytelling platform and community for people who have experienced head injuries. We created something positive and supportive for an injury commonly pushed under the rug by the NFL.

     development responsive design
